intro: Mesosphaerum fasciculatum, commonly known as the clustered globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The plant features yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, and its leaves are palmately divided with a hairy texture. Mesosphaerum fasciculatum has small, spherical fruits that contain seeds, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for study in desert ecosystems.
